Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, streaky black below; added red band lined in white; exterior: paired hook maeander band between pairs of lines at rim; below, painted decoration consisting of part of goat (back of neck, ear in outline and horn remaining), to right, overlapping the rim decoration; possibly pendant triangle, pendant roundel, dot rosette and elaborate cross as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as part of the Group of the Aphrodite Bowl, rather than as by the painter of the bowl, because the sherd displays a greater amount of variety in the filling ornaments, albeit similar to those on the Aphrodite Bowl (Lemos 1991, 74-5).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 74; p. 235, no. 143, pl. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0366) (phase 2)
